title: Live Updates: Israel Says It Killed Hezbollah Leader; Hezbollah Hasn’t Confirmed
content: The Israeli military did not say how it knew that the leader, Hassan Nasrallah, had been killed in an attack on what it described as Hezbollah’s headquarters in Lebanon.
summary: The Israeli military did not say how it knew that the leader, Hassan Nasrallah, had been killed in an attack on what it described as Hezbollah’s headquarters in Lebanon.

title: Laborer’s Death Brings to Light Italy’s Conflicted Relationship With Migrants
content: Italy, an aging country, badly needs migrant labor and immigration, but the government has admitted that the pathways for legal entry are rife with abuse.
summary: Italy, an aging country, badly needs migrant labor and immigration, but the government has admitted that the pathways for legal entry are rife with abuse.

title: How Fentanyl Enters the U.S., One American Smuggler at a Time
content: Mexican drug cartels are turning thousands of Americans into fentanyl smugglers, sending an army of couriers who can easily cross between both countries.
summary: Mexican drug cartels are turning thousands of Americans into fentanyl smugglers, sending an army of couriers who can easily cross between both countries.

title: Using Dance to Provoke, Delight and Tell South Africa’s Stories
content: Growing up in a Black township, Vusi Mdoyi found a sprinkle of joy under apartheid in a street-dancing style known as pantsula. As a choreographer, he has elevated it into high art, injected with ideas.
summary: Growing up in a Black township, Vusi Mdoyi found a sprinkle of joy under apartheid in a street-dancing style known as pantsula. As a choreographer, he has elevated it into high art, injected with ideas.

title: Inside the Lebanese Valley Where Israel Is Bombarding Hezbollah
content: The Bekaa Valley, a Hezbollah bastion in eastern Lebanon, had mostly been spared over 11 months of war. But The New York Times saw widespread devastation there after intense Israeli airstrikes this week.
summary: The Bekaa Valley, a Hezbollah bastion in eastern Lebanon, had mostly been spared over 11 months of war. But The New York Times saw widespread devastation there after intense Israeli airstrikes this week.

title: The Wily Spy Who Risked His Life to Meet North Korea’s Secretive Leader
content: Park Chae-so was so successful in infiltrating the North that Kim Jong-il, the enigmatic ruler, once gifted him blueberry wine. So why was the celebrated undercover agent later jailed by South Korea?
summary: Park Chae-so was so successful in infiltrating the North that Kim Jong-il, the enigmatic ruler, once gifted him blueberry wine. So why was the celebrated undercover agent later jailed by South Korea?

title: U.S.-Led Coalition in Iraq to Wind Down Its Mission
content: The United States has 2,500 troops in Iraq who served as a bulwark against attacks by a resurgent Islamic State.
summary: The United States has 2,500 troops in Iraq who served as a bulwark against attacks by a resurgent Islamic State.

title: Pope Francis Is Met With Anger Over Sexual Abuse on Visit to Belgium
content: During a trip to Luxembourg and Belgium, Francis spoke with 15 people who were abused by Roman Catholic clergy.
summary: During a trip to Luxembourg and Belgium, Francis spoke with 15 people who were abused by Roman Catholic clergy.

title: Brontë Sisters Plaque at Westminster Abbey Typo Fixed

summary: Punctuation delayed, but not denied: A memorial to Charlotte, Emily and Anne Brontë at Poets’ Corner in the celebrated London church finally gets its accent marks.

title: What to Know About Austria’s General Election and the Far-Right Freedom Party
content: Austrians will head to the polls on Sunday to elect a new Parliament, with the Freedom Party in position to potentially form a far-right government for the first time since World War II.
summary: Austrians will head to the polls on Sunday to elect a new Parliament, with the Freedom Party in position to potentially form a far-right government for the first time since World War II.

title: Deal to Reopen Libya’s Central Bank Eases Fears of Fighting
content: A standoff over control of the bank had destabilized the country’s economy and raised the prospect of fresh fighting between Libya’s eastern and western factions.
summary: A standoff over control of the bank had destabilized the country’s economy and raised the prospect of fresh fighting between Libya’s eastern and western factions.

title: Shigeru Ishiba to Be Next Prime Minister of Japan
content: Shigeru Ishiba, a former defense minister known for his plainspoken opinions, will replace Fumio Kishida next week.
summary: Shigeru Ishiba, a former defense minister known for his plainspoken opinions, will replace Fumio Kishida next week.

title: This Is What Can Land You in Jail for Sedition in Hong Kong
content: Three men were the first to be convicted under the city’s recently expanded national security law, which has greatly curtailed political speech.
summary: Three men were the first to be convicted under the city’s recently expanded national security law, which has greatly curtailed political speech.

title: Myanmar’s Military Asks Rebels to Stop Fighting and Join in Elections
content: Though the offer was quickly rejected by several commanders of the opposition forces, it was still seen as a significant development in the three-year civil war.
summary: Though the offer was quickly rejected by several commanders of the opposition forces, it was still seen as a significant development in the three-year civil war.

title: ‘We’re Still Living in Fear’: Escaping the Attacks in Lebanon

title: At Least Four Apartment Buildings Were Destroyed by Israeli Strikes, Videos Show

title: Who Is Hassan Nasrallah, the Leader of Hezbollah?

title: WADA Lost Track of Open Doping Cases Before Paris Olympics

title: Israel’s Pager Attacks in Lebanon and the Law on Booby Traps
content: After Israel detonated pagers and walkie-talkies in Lebanon, a fierce debate began about whether the attacks violated international law. A U.N. treaty from 1996 offers an answer.
summary: After Israel detonated pagers and walkie-talkies in Lebanon, a fierce debate began about whether the attacks violated international law. A U.N. treaty from 1996 offers an answer.

summary: A whirlwind week of top-level meetings failed to alleviate concerns in Kyiv that a Trump presidency could lead to a dramatic shift in American policy.

title: Finnish Zoo Returning Pandas to China Because of Cost
content: Two pandas are heading back to China eight years early amid lower-than-hoped-for visitor numbers at a zoo in rural Finland, and after the pair didn’t produce a cub.

title: Festival d’Automne in Paris Honors Rabih Mroué and Lina Majdalanie
